translated: Verses of the Elder Nuns .
The Group of Elevens
The Elder Nun Kisāgotamī’s Verses
“The Sage has praised

analyzed: lokam ādissa vaṇṇitā  kalyāṇa mitte bhajamānaḥ
translated: having good friends in the world; 🔽Even a fool would be wise
if they associate with good people.
One should associate with good people,
for wisdom increases for those who do;
if one associates with good people,
one would be freed from all suffering.
One should know suffering,
and the arising, ending, and path to the ending of suffering;
and the eight-factored path,
and the four noble truths.”
“The state of being a woman is suffering,
taught by the leader of people to be tamed;

original: Sapattikampi hi dukkhaṁ,🔽Appekaccā sakiṁ vijātāyo.🔽Galake api kantanti,
analyzed: sapattikam pi hi  appā ekaccā sakim  galake api kantanti
translated: for some, it’s suffering even with a husband, 🔽and for some, it’s suffering even when single. 🔽Some suckle at the breast of a stranger,
and some, though delicate, eat grass;
in the midst of the people’s slaughter,
both experience misfortune.”
“While walking along the road,
I saw my husband dead;
after giving birth on the road,
I had not yet reached my home.
Two sons had died,
And her husband died on the road,
Her mother, father, and brother,

analyzed: ḍayhanti ca ekacitakāya  khīṇa kulīne kapaṇe
translated: Were all cremated on the same pyre.”🔽“You’ve experienced immeasurable suffering,
You wretched woman of low birth.
You’ve shed many tears,
And been reborn many thousands of times.
You’ve lived in the middle of a charnel ground,
And eaten the flesh of your own children.

analyzed: hata kulikā sabbaga rahitā  mata patikā amatam adhigacchi  bhāvitaḥ me maggo
translated: You’re a widow, abandoned by all,🔽But you’ve attained the deathless, O you whose husband is dead.🔽The noble eightfold path,
Which leads to the deathless, has been developed by me.
I’ve realized extinguishment,
And I’ve seen the mirror of the Teaching.

analyzed: aham amhi kanta sallā  ohita bhārā katañhi karaṇīya
translated: I’m free from the dart of passion,🔽I’ve laid down the burden and done what had to be done.
Kisā Gotamī, the senior nun,
With mind free, spoke this verse.”
… the senior nun Kisā Gotamī …
The collection of elevens is finished.
